title: Watering
description: Most indoor plants prefer their soil to dry out between waterings. Overwatering can harm roots.

title: Sunlight
description: Place plants in indirect sunlight. Direct harsh sun can scorch leaves, while too little light slows growth.

title: Fertilizing
description: Feed plants with a balanced liquid fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during growing season. Avoid over-fertilizing.

title: Humidity
description: Many tropical plants thrive in 50-60% humidity. Mist leaves or use a humidifier if air is dry.

title: Pruning
description: Remove yellow or dead leaves regularly to promote healthy growth and improve appearance.

title: Repotting
description: Repot plants every 1-2 years or when roots outgrow the pot. Use fresh soil and a slightly larger container.

title: Pest Control
description: Check plants regularly for pests like aphids or spider mites. Treat early with insecticidal soap if needed.
